roleset.name: report, tell, writing/work-of-art, relating info, formally
roleset.note: REPORT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls say-37.7-1, consider-29.9-1, characterize-29.2-1-2. Updated by Julia, 10/2010. (from report.01-v)
REPORT-N NOTES: Roleset based on report.01. Verbnet class say 37.7 and charactorize-29.2. Framed by Katie (from report.01-n)
REPORTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, report-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls say-37.7-1, consider-29.9-1, characterize-29.2-1-2. (from reporting.01-n)

example.name: just the news
example.text: Commonwealth Edison reported earnings of $737 million.

example.name: just hearer
example.text: He will report to Donald Pardus.

example.name: passivized
example.text: [Preliminary findings]-1 were reported *trace*-1 more than a year ago by the AMA

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: [Retail sales]-1 were reported *trace*-1 slow in most districts.

example.name: another passive extraction
example.text: [Hammersmith]-1 is reported *trace*-1 to have been sold.

example.name: untargeted passive
example.text: This goes past what-1 had been reported *trace*-1 before.

example.name: fronted
example.text: [The FBI found evidence for an alien invasion]-1, Agt Mulder reported *trace*-1

example.name: inverted
example.text: [Japanese corporations bought South Dakota]-1, reported *trace*-1 Newsweek.

example.name: discourse-connective
example.text: As *trace-1* reported *trace-2*, John said something stupid again.

example.name: Example with all args
example.text: its report to Congress on international economic policies

example.name: Example with arg 0 and arg 1
example.text: Their report on a struggle that affects more than ten million americans
example.arg: on a struggle that affects more than ten million americans

example.name: all args
example.text: The inconsistencies in Dorner's various explanations as to why there was a delay in his reporting the alleged kicks to a supervisor
